SEARCH
Package gw.plugin.document

Interface IDocumentContentSourceBase

All Superinterfaces:
InternalPlugin, Remote
All Known Subinterfaces:
IDocumentContentSource
public interface IDocumentContentSourceBase extends InternalPlugin
Interface to a DocumentManagementSystem. Used to add, update and retrieve the contents of documents.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    addDocument(InputStream content, Document document)
    Adds a new document to the repository.

  • Method Details

    • isInboundAvailable

      boolean isInboundAvailable()
      If the external DMS is available for the desired actions. inbound methods 'addDocument', 'updateDocument', 'removeDocument'
      Returns:
      true if those service are available

    • isOutboundAvailable

      boolean isOutboundAvailable()
      If the external DMS is available for the desired actions. outbound methods 'isDocument', 'getDocumentContentsInfo'
      Returns:
      true if those services are available

    • addDocument

      boolean addDocument(InputStream content, Document document)
      Adds a new document to the repository. Note this method may require some UI for accessing a DMS.
      Parameters:
      content - A document as an input stream.
      document - The Document object (containing metadata) corresponding to the content
      Returns:
      true if the Document metadata has been persisted as well (in a way retrieveable by the IDocumentMetadataSource implementation) and further work by CC is not necessary

    • isDocument

      boolean isDocument(Document document)
      An document existence check.
      Parameters:
      document - The Document object whose content we are looking for
      Returns:
      True if a document exists with the specified criteria.

    • getDocumentContentsInfo

      DocumentContentsInfo getDocumentContentsInfo(Document document, boolean includeContents)
      Returns the content info of the document corresponding to the specified document's unique id (UID). The format of the document UID is implementation specific. Note that the contents of DocumentContentsInfo is dependent on its response type (in the out of the box implementation this is the mode passed in as a parameter in the plugin definition), which can either be "contents", "url", "html", or "jscript". Logically the include contents is only meaningful when a site has selected contents or html as its mode as the content string for url or jscript is the url or jscript.
      Parameters:
      document - A document containing an implementation specific identifier (UID) and any other information required to retrieve concrete contents.
      includeContents - true if the actual contents of the document should be included, false if only the metadata about the contents (response type, mime type, etc) should be returned. If this is false, then the InputStream in the returned DocumentContentsInfo entity should be null.
      Returns:
      A DocumentContentsInfo entity that may containing both the actual contents of the document and metadata about that content.

    • getDocumentContentsInfoForExternalUse

      DocumentContentsInfo getDocumentContentsInfoForExternalUse(Document document)
      Returns the content info of the document corresponding to the specified document's unique id (UID) for external use. The format of the document UID is implementation specific. This is used by EmailMessageTransport for documents included in emails that have external recipients, the contents of DocumentContentsInfo this should either be content or a url that is reachable by external all recipients of the email.
      Parameters:
      document - A document containing an implementation specific identifier (UID) and any other information required to retrieve concrete contents.
      Returns:
      A DocumentContentsInfo entity that may contain both the actual contents of the document and metadata about that content.

    • updateDocument

      boolean updateDocument(Document document, InputStream isDocument)
      Modifies the content of an existing document in the repository.
      Parameters:
      document - The document to update, which must have the necessary fields (like UID) set
      isDocument - The new content stream.
      Returns:
      true if the IDocumentContentSource implementation has taken care of persisting any required changes to the Document metadata (modification dates, version numbers, etc), false otherwise

    • removeDocument

      boolean removeDocument(Document document)
      Notify the document access system that a document has been removed from ClaimCenter. It is left to the implementation what actions should be taken as a result, but one key implication is that another document may be created in the future with the same name.
      Parameters:
      document - The document to be de-linked in the DMS
      Returns:
      true if the metadata for the document has also been removed from the IDocumentMetadataSource implementation, and no further action is necessary
